definition: Kim Il Sung (1912-1994) Great Leader of North Korea
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sun/day/date, day of the month

to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Female North Korean soldiers attend an exhibition of Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia flowers.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮女兵參觀“金日成”花展。

sentences.english: Mansudae Grand Monument, Mansu Hill, people's revolutionary struggle memorial.
sentences.chinese: 萬壽臺，金日成銅像旁的人民解放紀念碑。

sentences.english: The high point of the pilgrimage circuit is Kim Il Sung's mausoleum.
sentences.chinese: 金日成陵墓是至高無上的這麼一個地方。

sentences.english: Both of them had participated in my previous negotiations with Kim Il-sung.
sentences.chinese: 他們二人都曾參加當初我和金日成的談判。

sentences.english: The tower is lined up directly with the statue of Kim Il-sung on Mansu Hill on the opposite side of the river.
sentences.chinese: 該塔與河對岸萬壽山的金日成銅像直接排列在一起。

sentences.english: The sound of three bangs on a gong signalled the impending arrival of Kim’s son and grandson.
sentences.chinese: 三聲鑼聲宣示金日成的兒子和孫子的即將到來。

sentences.english: People bowing to Mansudae Grand Monument, Mansu Hill.
sentences.chinese: 萬壽臺上，向金日成銅像鞠躬的人們。

sentences.english: And North Korea is celebrating the 101st birthday of its first President Kim Il Sung.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮慶祝首位總統金日成誕辰101週年。

sentences.english: Reeducation involved memorizing speeches by Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il.
sentences.chinese: 改造“還包括背誦金日成和金正日的語錄。

sentences.english: He and his colleagues started with a video about the Kim Il Sung era.
sentences.chinese: 石丸和他的同事們選擇了一個關於金日成時代的視頻。

definition: Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the ruling party of North Korea

Kim Jong-un (c. 1983-), third son of Kim Jong-il 金正日[Jin1 Zheng4 ri4], supreme leader of North Korea from 2011
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Syngman Rhee (1875-1965), US trained Korean politician and dictator, president of Republic of Korea 1948-1960
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
volunteer army
the Chinese People's Volunteer Army deployed by China to aid North Korea in 1950
